The plant is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes, and it has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria. Acacia reficiens thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various native animals.
